title: March 2024 meeting:  Disobedient, by Elizabeth Freemantle
event_time: Wednesday, March 20, 20247:00 PM to 9:00 PM CET
description: above photo: Artemisia Gentileschi, Self-portrait as Catherine of Alexandria , 1615-1617, National Gallery, London, UK. You do NOT need to know anything about art history to deeply enjoy this novel. Author Elizabeth Freemantle envelops us in the sights, sounds, and smells of 17th-century Rome. This is fiction, but it is based upon the events of the shocking and astonishing real-life story of Artemisia Gentileschi. The immense amount of historical research is worn lightly but has a vivid impact. It may be hard for us to fully understand the extreme limitations placed on female artists for so long. Artemisia Gentileschi, born in 1593, had access to the art world through her father, the Tuscan painter Orazio Gentileschi. She was influenced by Carravagio (known as Merisi in the novel). All women at the time faced huge obstacles to get their work seen, and Artemisia Gentileschi was no different. Not only that, but she was determined to paint from the female perspective, something very new. edited summary from DailyArt magazine

description: Data : 20/03/2024 T√≠tol : Ones Gravitacionals per a curiosos Ponent : Miquel Santasusana Bio ponent: Miquel Santasusana Isach √©s doctor en enginyeria i m√†ster en astrof√≠sica per la Universitat Aut√≤noma de Barcelona. Ha estat investigador al Centre Internacional de M√®todes Num√®rics en Enginyeria i ha treballat al detector d‚Äôones gravitacionals VIRGO a It√†lia. Actualment √©s professor d‚Äôenginyeria a Elisava i dirigeix Spacetime Syndicate, empresa dedicada a la creaci√≥ d‚Äôexperi√®ncies immersives relacionades amb la ci√®ncia. title: *The return of DOXELONA* - Viaplay Group, Allianz Technology, Veriff
event_time: Thursday, April 4, 20246:30 PM to 8:00 PM CEST
vanue_location_detail: Av. Diagonal, 123, Sant Mart√≠ ¬∑ Spain, al
description: After 4 years (we can't quite believe it's been that long) since our last onsite event, we are thrilled to be back on Thursday 4th April for our next DevOps Exchange Barcelona event! Hosted in Sant Mart√≠ by our good friends at Veriff , we are officially back with a great line-up in store for you, as we welcome to the stage talks from; leading entertainment provider Viaplay Group , IT service management company Allianz Technology and our hosts at Veriff . First up on stage we welcome Pablo Bouzad from Viaplay Group who will dive into what he sees as the most critical factors and common issues when an organisation tries to change its culture, why organisations or employees refuse to accept the change and how to work with them and alter their perspective. Next up, we have Pere Alcoberro from Allianz Technology who will discuss why you would want to migrate to Crossplane, including use-cases, the adoption curve, and how it works now in Allianz Technology. Finally, Ricard Borr√†s Navarra from our hosts at Veriff will delve into how they deploy computer vision models by leveraging a mix of classic software engineering techniques combined with the latest AWS tooling. Doors will open at 6:30pm with talks starting at 7pm. There will be 3 x 20 minute talks followed by a Q & A session. Refreshments will be provided, courtesy of Veriff! For this event we have a limit on capacity, so if you're interested in attending please RSVP as soon as possible to avoid missing out. Please amend your RSVP if you can no longer make it, to free up the space for someone else. Agenda: 7:00pm: Pablo Bouzada , Software Engineering Manager @ Viaplay Group "Culture really matters" DevOps is not a product you can buy and set up. It is not a process or framework you choose to follow up. Building microservice applications neither means you are doing DevOps. You can‚Äôt be DevOps and traditional; there‚Äôs no cherry-picking, requires a change in the whole organisation's CULTURE. The culture of an organisation is the way in which things are done, the behaviours, values and practices that have been developed and reinforced over time. Culture has a big impact on the way things are done inside an organisation and is the more important factor in innovation levels and the improvement of products and processes. In this talk we will see what are the most critical factors when an organisation try to change its culture, which are common issues, why some organisations or persons refuse to accept the change... and how to work with them. Bio: With over 15 years of hands-on experience in programming, Pablo is a seasoned professional who has successfully transitioned into leadership roles, currently serving as an Engineering Manager in international companies. 7:20pm: Pere Alcoberro , DevOps Architect @ Allianz Technology "Terraform to Crossplane, Our Journey" Why we want to migrate to Crossplane, use-cases, the adoption curve, and how it works now in Allianz Technology. Bio: Cloud & DevOps Architect and Team Lead in Allianz Technology. 7:40pm: Ricard Borr√†s Navarra , Staff machine learning engineer @ Veriff "Deploying Machine Learning models at scale without DevOps help" This talk will explain how we deploy computer vision models at Veriff by leveraging a mix of classic software engineering techniques combined with the latest AWS tooling. I will explain how we cut down our model deployment time from 10 days to 1 day and inference costs by 75%. Bio: I have a strong background in computer vision and leadership in complex AI projects, turning research projects into practical solutions. My expertise encompasses AWS, Python, MLOps, PyTorch, and computer vision. *Please note that attendees will be required to sign an NDA upon entering the event venue. We hope that you are able to join us for this event! We are back running regular events in Barcelona, so if you are unable to make this specific event, keep an eye on our Meetup page for our next event, coming soon. All the best, The DOXELONA team Our Sponsors.. LinuxRecruit LinuxRecruit links top industry talent with premier hiring companies across Europe. Drop by and say hi to learn more!

title: Photography and Modeling Meetup Barcelona

title: Skiing & Snowboarding weekend trip to Andorra (March 22nd - March 24th 2024)
event_time: Friday, March 22, 2024 at 8:00 PM to Sunday, March 24, 2024 at 9:00 PM CET
description: Please make sure you enter your email address when you RSVP to this event. If you don't, you will not receive booking information! There is limited places on this trip due to the season being so busy already so please sign up ASAP. Your place is not confirmed on the trip until payment is received Details below: Let's ski in Andorra over the weekend! This trip is open to everyone and is a great way to enjoy Skiing or snowboarding and meet new people! We have all levels of ability come on our trips from complete beginners to professional. Andorra is easily accessible from Barcelona and some of the best skiing in Europe. Everyone is welcome, come on your own or with friends. We will use a ski tour company to organise the trip (details to follow), this meetup group is so that we can organise to go together regularly. The trip will include bus from Barcelona to Andorra, bus to and from the slopes on Saturday and Sunday, 2 nights hotel accommodation and 2 day ski passes. Some food will also be included: breakfast and dinner on the Saturday and Breakfast on the Sunday. The cost is ‚Ç¨264 and we will be staying at the Hotel Coray in encamp, Andorra. Whats included: ‚Ä¢ Bus to Andorra Friday at 20.00 h (departure at 8pm from Palau Reial (https://www.google.es/maps/search/palau+reial/@41.3867274,2.1211402,16.79z?hl=en)) ‚Ä¢ 2 night in double bedroom (breakfast & dinner on Saturday and breakfast on Sunday) ‚Ä¢ 2 day ski pass in Grandvalira (the biggest and best resort in Andorra) ‚Ä¢ Bus to and from ski slopes Saturday and Sunday ‚Ä¢ Bus back to Barcelona I need final numbers as soon as possible! So please RSVP if you want to come! Your trip is NOT confirmed until you make payment. Trips get fully booked within a few days! In the group there are skiers of all levels from complete beginners to advanced. If it's your first time skiing or snowboarding, you will need the following: ‚Ä¢ Ski or snowboarding trousers ‚Ä¢ Gloves (best to get ski gloves otherwise your hands will get cold and wet) ‚Ä¢ Ski jacket ‚Ä¢ Base layer ‚Ä¢ Middle layers (tshirt etc) ‚Ä¢ Fleece ‚Ä¢ Scarf or buff ‚Ä¢ Ski goggles ‚Ä¢ Ski socks (100% wool if you can) ‚Ä¢ Waterproof boots for walking around when your not skiing ‚Ä¢ Suntan lotion (50+ sun factor recommended) ‚Ä¢ Ski insurance (optional but a good idea!) It's best to have multiple layers so you can take off or add clothing if you get too hot or cold. You can buy all of this very cheaply in Decathlon. Its best to try and borrow as much stuff as you can for your first time so you can give it a try with out spending too much money. It's possible to organise ski lessons for beginners or improvers. And all ski equipment is available to hire as part of the trip. Important note: This group is just so we can arrange to go together, it is not a organised ski trip, you will need your own insurance or healthcare cover and we take no responsibility for your safety. Ski safe!

title: LLM-based reasoning on your business data
event_time: Wednesday, March 20, 20246:30 PM to 8:30 PM CET
description: InnoIT Consulting are delighted to invite you to our meetup next Wednesday, March 20th at 18:30h . LLM-based reasoning on your business data SUMMARY The speaker will be Albert Vilamala (Neosoftia Co-founder & AI Consultant) . Join us for ‚ÄúLLM-Based Reasoning on Your Business Data‚Äù, where we'll explore the synergy between language models and business insights . Start with an introduction to Large Language Models (LLMs), their definition, and training process. Uncover the advantages and limitations of LLMs in reasoning on domain-specific data through various approaches: Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), Fine-Tuning, and Pre-Training from scratch. Dive into the specifics of RAG, covering its different variants (naive, advanced, and modular) and illustrating their indexing and querying phases. Navigate through practical challenges, addressing issues in reading, parsing, embedding, and querying, offering innovative solutions for effective implementation. Explore essential extras such as guardrails and evaluation metrics, enhancing your understanding of LLMs and RAG for transformative business data reasoning. All are spiced with insights from our journey, with ample room for a dynamic Q&A session and of course our networking with food and drinks. Join us in unlocking the potential of LLMs and RAG to leverage business knowledge! WHEN: Wednesday, March 20th at 18:30h WHERE: Aticco Bail√©n (C/ de Bail√®n, 105, L'Eixample, Barcelona) LANGUAGE: English Feel free to circulate it among your colleagues and network. üìù Join our newsletter! title: Adopting Julia: ASML's Julia journey & how to transition from Matlab
event_time: Thursday, April 11, 20246:00 PM to 8:30 PM CEST
description: We're thrilled to reignite the Julia Lang Meetups in Barcelona! After a hiatus, we're back and more excited than ever to bring together the Julia programming community in our beautiful city. Whether you're a seasoned Julia programmer, just starting out, or curious about the capabilities of this high performance programming language, this event is for you. Join us for an evening filled with insightful talks from experts in the field, including practical insights from adopting Julia in production at ASML and experiences transitioning from Matlab to Julia. This is a fantastic opportunity to deepen your understanding, connect with Julia experts and contribute to the growing Julia community. Join us as we kickstart the Julia community in Barcelona once again! Agenda: 6:00 PM: Doors Open 6:30 PM: Welcome & Agenda Overview 6:40 PM: Talk 1 - Short introduction to Julia by Pere Gim√©nez 7:00 PM: Talk 2 - ASML Julia Journey by Jorge Vieyra 7:30 PM: Talk 3 - From Matlab to Julia by Gareth Thomas 8:00 PM: Refreshments and networking Talk Details: Talk 1: A beginner's introduction to Julia Speaker: Pere Gim√©nez, Data Science Advocate at Genie We‚Äôll begin the evening with an introduction to Julia, exploring its core features, benefits, and applications. This short talk is ideal for newcomers and those interested in understanding why Julia is becoming a preferred language in scientific computing and beyond. Talk 2: ASML's Julia Journey Speaker: Jorge Vieyra, Senior Development Engineer at ASML Gain insights into how ASML, a leader in the semiconductor industry and the most valuable high tech company in Europe, is leveraging Julia in their operations. This talk will cover the motivations for adopting Julia, the challenges encountered, and the successes achieved. Talk 3: From Matlab to Julia: learnings Speaker: Gareth Thomas, Co-Founder at VersionBay, scientific software developer and Matlab expert The presentation will cover 4 projects Gareth undertook to immerse himself in Julia. It reflects the challenges and discoveries he encountered during his initial 10 hours with Julia, coming from a Matlab background. Additional Information: Refreshments will be provided Please RSVP to ensure your spot. If you're interested in speaking at the next Meetup or in volunteering to organize the next event, please reach out!

title: Social Media Creators & Influencer Meetup Barcelona
event_time: Thursday, April 11, 20246:30 PM to 8:30 PM CEST
description: Hi there, fellow social media creators, influencers, brands and all people interested in Barcelona. Welcome to our meetup! We at Social Rising organize regular events for you to connect, learn and grow, not only here but all over the world! We invite you to meet and engage in conversations with like-minded people both locally and in our worldwide community! First things first!: The best way to stay informed about our events is to join our newsletter at socialrising.com/join . If you're a creator with a significant audience , you will benefit the most from this newsletter at socialrising.com/join . You will be invited to public and exclusive events, and we will reach out to you with partner and job opportunities. If you want to help us creating our events: We're looking for 1-2 volunteers per event! Let us know if you're intersted through this form: https://socialrising.com/volunteer - we'll then reach out if we need you. What do participants & speakers think? "Matteo's meetups are incredible. Every time I come, I meet people who genuinely change my life. He somehow manages to get everyone involved, and the overall vibe is so nice. Can't wait for the next one!" - Dom (tech_wizzdom) "Matteo, thanks for the event yesterday. Its much better than other social media events that I have attended. Good work! So thanks!" Joe (via a Google Review) "What a fantastic group of people! If you are looking to connect with top-shelf digital communicators, Social Rising's meetups are perfect for that."- Oliver Aust - Founder, Investor, Bestselling Author, Podcast Host. "Matteo put on a killer event. Normally events are full of trivial, uncomfortable conversations, but I love Social Rising events, cool people and discussion points, and great locations", Digital Nomad Lifestyle. Our story In 2019 we started organizing meetups for creators & influencer in Berlin, and we became big fans of the people we brought together and the topics that were discussed. So we expanded to London early 2020, and as the pandemic started, we became a home for creators worldwide. Now, in 2023, we do our events in multiple cities and countries and are expanding to more and more countries. Wherever we are, influencers & creators connect, learn, and grow. Sometimes creators join us and share insights in lightning talks, and each time we all go home with new, interesting connections! Virtual events We have regular virtual meetups. Join your local meetup group ( https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups ) or follow our Eventbrite organizer dedicated to virtual events ( https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/o/social-rising-virtual-34048034485 ). What is this meetup for? Get to know new people in the social media space Share experiences with like-minded people Listen to inspiring lightning talks Brainstorm and share ideas with fellow creators Motivating each other Finding opportunities to work together Discuss how to approach and reach chosen target groups Sometimes we have a product/brand presenting how they can support you ... and of course: have a good time and grab a drink together! Your host Matteo Savio, CEO of Social Rising & Digital Ideas , hosts the event. As a digital marketer, he is consulting in B2B marketing & sales, and started Social Rising in 2019 as became fascinated by the topics and amazing people that showed up. He's enthusiastic ever since! Connect with him beforehand on LinkedIn ! What next? Do you have experiences in growing and/or monetizing on Social Media? We'd love you to apply for a lightning talk: socialrising.com/lightning-talk . Are you interested in helping us creating our events? Help out as a volunteer: socialrising.com/volunteer . Follow us on Instagram and check out event images from past events: instagram.com/socialrisingevents . Especially as a brand or product you might be interested in following us on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/socialrisingevents . Does your product bring value to creators? Apply for a product presentation: socialrising.com/product-presentation . Join the meetup group closest to you here: https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups . See you at the event! Your Social Rising Team

title: Free Life Coaching Session
event_time: Monday, April 1, 202411:00 AM to 12:00 PM CEST
description: Step into the world of playful transformation with me, your personal Life Coach! As we embark on this journey together, let's take a moment to remember what it felt like to play without a care in the world. My mission is to advocate for the gamification of life, infusing the busy lives of individuals with the rejuvenating power of play. Together, we'll rediscover the joy of simply being ourselves and tap into that childlike wonder that often gets lost as we grow older. It's a common observation that traits like playfulness, fun-seeking, uninhibitedness, and spontaneity tend to diminish as we distance ourselves from childhood. But here's the thing: it doesn't have to be this way. Embracing playfulness not only expands our thinking but also fosters a deeper sense of self-awareness, compassion, and joy. As a Certified Mindvalley Life Coach, I'm dedicated to supporting your journey and helping you reconnect with your inner child. Play is not just reserved for kids‚Äîit's a fundamental aspect of human experience that we can benefit from throughout our lives. By embracing play, we create space for endless possibilities and new ways of thinking without the burden of stress entering our body. Together, we'll uncover the underlying motivations behind your thoughts and reframe them, empowering you to take tangible actions that propel you forward on your journey to personal growth and fulfillment. Are you ready to unlock the transformative power of play? Reach out to me today, and let's get started! As I'm just starting out in the field, I'm excited to offer free coaching sessions throughout March and April. I invite you to take advantage of this opportunity to experience coaching firsthand! I am not a medical professional. As a Life Coach, I am not providing healthcare, medical, or nutritional therapy services or attempting to diagnose, treat, prevent, or cure any physical, mental, or emotional issue. The information provided here is for informational purposes only and is not intended to substitute professional medical advice, diagnoses, or treatment.

title: Yin yoga class in English
event_time: Thursday, March 21, 20248:00 PM to 9:00 PM CET
description: Yin Yoga Yin yoga is an easy going, relaxing yoga style and by time you can make it more challenging for yourself. We focus on the deeper levels of the body; joints, ligaments, fascia and bones to make them stronger and more flexible even. Yin yoga removes the blockages deep in our connective tissues allowing the Chi/prana (life energy) to flow unhindered. Most forms of yoga today are dynamic, active practices designed to work only half of our body, the muscular half, the ‚Äúyang‚Äù tissues. Yin Yoga allows us to work the other half, the deeper ‚Äúyin‚Äù parts. Mentally Yin Yoga can be challenging at times because we stay in one pose for a few minutes focusing on the stillness of the body, stillness of the breath and stillness of the mind. Yin Yoga classes in English are held on Thursday evenings 8pm - 9pm at ElUp Studio, Carrer de Trafalgar 48. Prices: 11.50euros/class 65euros/6classes (this bundle via my website www.kittyroot.com)

Yin yoga removes the blockages deep in our connective tissues allowing the Chi/prana (life energy) to flow unhindered. Most forms of yoga today are dynamic, active practices designed to work only half of our body, the muscular half, the ‚Äúyang‚Äù tissues. Yin Yoga allows us to work the other half, the deeper ‚Äúyin‚Äù parts. Mentally Yin Yoga can be challenging at times because we stay in one pose for a few minutes focusing on the stillness of the body, stillness of the breath and stillness of the mind. Yin Yoga classes in English are held on Thursday evenings 8pm - 9pm at ElUp Studio, Carrer de Trafalgar 48. Prices: 11.50euros/class 65euros/6classes (this bundle via my website www.kittyroot.com)

title: MobileApp Security:Everything you ever wanted to know and were too afraid to ask
hosted_by: Olmo R. and Laura Del Barrio D.
event_time: Thursday, April 11, 20246:45 PM to 9:00 PM CEST
description: Hello community! We're thrilled to announce the upcoming event of the season, in collaboration with our annual sponsor, Build38 ! This is an opportunity you won't want to miss! üìÖ Date : April 11th üïí Time : 18:45 üìç Location : Build38 Offices (Avinguda Josep Tarradellas, 38, floor 9) Why is Mobile App Security is in a league of its own? We get this allot! Join us for a deep dive into how Mobile App Security is different from "traditional" cybersecurity. ‚Ä¢ Explore Mobile (Android and iOS) App Security and delve into the fundamentals, motivations, and most important assets to protect in the mobile ecosystems while gaining insights into attackers' mindsets. ‚Ä¢ From secure networking to root/jailbreak detection and IP protection, we'll set a more "theoretical" groundwork for a robust mobile strategy with essential knowledge for developers to secure mobile apps against common security threats. ‚Ä¢ Share insights on the underlying principles and significance of each security measure, this isn't just about sharing code that can be easily replicated into an app. Don't miss out on the opportunity to elevate your mobile app security know-how! title: Icebreaker Cards - DeeperTalks - Make new friends Club
hosted_by: Icebreakers - Deeper Talks - Make new friends Club
event_time: Saturday, March 23, 202411:30 AM to 1:00 PM CET
vanue_location_detail: C. de Pau Claris, 85 ¬∑ Barcelona, CT
description: Many people crave great conversations, but few know how to start one. That's why we'll be using designated icebreaker cards ‚Äî hoping a good question will be the tiny spark that ignites thoughts, ideas, and personal revelations. These cards are designed to foster deeper or more entertaining conversations than if you had simply asked, "How are you?" "How was work?" or "Did you see that thing on the news?" Everyone will pick a different question, and then take turns answering. Principles: Don't force anyone to talk about what they're not ready for Be fully present Take your time Genuinely listen Embrace the tangents

title: üßòüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Sharing Circle - She Speaks Power
event_time: Friday, March 22, 20247:00 PM to 9:00 PM CET
description: Do you want to connect with other women in a safe and supportive space? Do you want to share your fears, problems, and concerns with people who understand and empathize? Do you want to receive and offer encouragement, advice, and inspiration? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then join us for a special sharing circle in Ciutadella Park. This is a free and open event, where women of all backgrounds, ages, and experiences are welcome. A sharing circle is a simple and powerful way to create meaningful connections and foster mutual support. We will sit in a circle, and each person will have the opportunity to speak from the heart, without interruption or judgment. We will listen with compassion and respect, and honor each other‚Äôs confidentiality and privacy. This is not a therapy session, but a peer-to-peer exchange of stories, feelings, and perspectives. description: Hey Wild women!! Im really excited to share with you my next workshop. ‚ú® Are you ready to Accept and release your Anger? There may have been many times in your life where didn't feel safe to express your emotions and especially anger. You may have suppressed your anger your whole life. ‚ú®When we start healing and start noticing anger it can be quite scary and we might not know what to do with all this built up energy and end up storing it all in our bodies Causing dis- ease and denying our Authentic self.
